article.description: Marcus Romain scored 19 points and had nine rebounds to lead Mississippi Valley State to the season sweep over Grambling State 58-57 on Monday night.
article.headline: Mississippi Valley State holds off Grambling State 58-57
article.linkText: Mississippi Valley State holds off Grambling State 58-57
article.story: GRAMBLING, La. -- Marcus Romain scored 19 points and had nine rebounds to lead Mississippi Valley State to the season sweep over Grambling State 58-57 on Monday night. Mississippi Valley State (6-25, 6-11 SWAC) led 57-47 after a Romain layup with 1:31 left. However Grambling State scored the next eight points, six coming from Arnold Richmond, which trimmed the Delta Devils lead to 57-55 with 22 seconds remaining. Isaac Williams added a free throw for a 58-55 Mississippi Valley State lead, and Rashaan Surles fouled Richmond before he could attempt a potential game tying 3-pointer. He hit both free throws, but the Tigers (6-22, 3-13) never got the ball back. Williams had 12 points for the Delta Devils, who snapped a five game skid. Richmond led Grambling State with 13 points and Carlton Lowe added 10. The Tigers have lost 11 in a row.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
